author: John Q

review: Amazon fireTV stick is a real disappointment. It is released more than a year after chromecast and is even not better than the apps on my three years old smart tv and does not provide any additional useful features to my TV. There is no way to control it through your laptop, there is no way to stream any contents from your computer, there is no way to browse the internet, there is no way to mirror your computer screen on the television. To control it and work with it, you should use the provided remote control which just takes a lot of time to enter a simple title (yes, using only arrows on the remote you should enter "It is always sunny in Philadelphia"!!). Amazon claims that they have an android app to fix it but there is no IOS app and no way to control it through the computer. It is truly a big disappointment. I bought it through the special offer (19$) for the prime members but even that does not worth it.

review: Have been using it for two days now, and the stick seems to work well.  The initial updating process took about 5 to 10 minutes.  Menu layout is very linear, so navigation isn't quite as easy as a Roku, but is fairly intuitive (I have no previous Fire TV experience).  Control via Fire TV app for Android is very convenient, and flinging apps from phone to screen is simple enough.Complaints so far:-I was watching a Netflix video but sent a YouTube video to my screen to watch.  No immediately obvious way to switch directly back to Netflix without going back to homescreen, re-entering the app, selecting account, and continuing playback.  Using the back button on the remote only takes me back to the YouTube "What to Watch" menu.-The screen-mirroring option is buried in settings and doesn't seem to work with my Samsung Galaxy S5.  It would be nice for this to be more upfront and functional.I'll keep an eye on system updates to see how things progress.

review: This product is not working on my Sharp tv (model LC-26SB24U).  The initial amazon screen appears then goes away as if the device were disconnected. My chromecast works just fine in the same HDMI port which shows that it is a problem with the fire stick, and not my TV.I was able to get it working on a friend's Sony TV (I don't have the model number) and it's actually pretty nice.  However, if they don't fix the compatibility issue, I will have to return it.  I would rate the product at least 4 stars if there wasn't compatibility issues.
